answers.answer: If I got those results, I'd celebrate.  I'm not a health professional, but after dealing with some serious heart issues the last fifteen years I'd had dozens and dozens of tests.When you see 'normal' attached to your report, that is just that.  When we see the word 'Trivial', this is to my thinking normal, especially referring to regurgitation.  There probably isn't a person on the planet that has a 100% tight seal, everyone leaks a little bit.  It is only when the valves get cholesterol coated that you see more advanced disease.  Cardiologists use the words Trivial, Mild, Moderate, Moderate-Severe, and Severe when referring to conditions.  I'm sure you have had blood tests; how are your cholesterol levels, diabetes readings, weight?  Do you smoke?  What is your stress level?  These are things to lead to heart problems.Yes, there are additional tests, the next thing will be a nuclear stress test, and perhaps an angiogram where a wire is inserted through your groin to the heart and radiation is used to view your heart function.I'd trust the doctors diagnosis, work on physical/diet issues and see if your symptoms disappear.  I was where you were 30 years ago but didn't improve my lifestyle which led to serious heart disease.  I find it hard to walk to the mailbox 100 yards away.  I'd stay away from the popular over the counter 'cures', follow the doctor's diet and exercise ideas.  Keep us informed.

question: For the past two months I've had heart palpitations, felt short of breath often, and had no tolerance for exercise. My heart pounds from walking up the stairs. I've also felt dizzy and had pain or heaviness in my left arm at times.I have had the following tests so far:EKG: normalChest xray: normalCT Scan: normal48 hour Holter monitor: Some ectopic beatsechocardiogram: normal, trace mitral regurgition and trace pulmonic valvular regurgitationI am quite concerned about all of this, but my doctor seems to think that the echo rules out any possible heart problems. I am not overweight and previously had a good level of fitness.Are there any additional tests that can be performed? What should I do next?
title: Heart Issues, but normal tests so far?
